summary: Yoongi and Taehyung - You fall asleep on them You tuck your face into your boyfriend’s neck with a sigh. You missed this so...
body:
Yoongi and Taehyung - You fall asleep on them

You tuck your face into your boyfriend’s neck with a sigh. You missed this so much. It seems like he’s always busy - doing this, going there, a photoshoot here and a concert there… it drives you crazy. But all of that is so completely worth it for the hours you spend together when he comes home. He basically moves into your apartment for a while, and you curl up and do domestic things like what you’re doing right now. You’re watching a cooking show!

A boring cooking show, it seems, since it doesn’t take long for your eyes to start drooping. A few minutes after that, and the feeling of your boyfriend’s body next to yours helps to relax into a deep sleep. It takes a little while longer for your boyfriend to look down and see that you are actually fast asleep and snoring softly, too.

Yoongi

Yoongi looks down at you with one raised eyebrow, thinking about two things. One is how on earth he got so lucky, and the other is how much he wishes this could happen more often. Naps on the couch and waking up in each other’s arms is the most heavenly experience, and Yoongi never wants it to end. Then his next schedule comes along, and he has to, but he won’t let such a thing loom over his head,

“You’re so annoying,” Yoongi mutters to you, not meaning a word of it. If you were awake, you’d hear the sardonic tone, but you’re still clutching his shirt tightly as you rest. With a smallest smile, Yoongi shifts you to straddle him, tucking your face more comfortably into his neck as he grapples for a fluffy blanket. He knows it must be here somewhere, since you never let it get too far away from you. When Yoongi finds it, he pulls it over the both of you gently, so that he doesn’t make you stir again. It’s warm and cocoons the both of you in a small bundle of warm love that Yoongi can’t help but snuggle into as his eyes focus back on the show.

Taehyung

The laugh that Taehyung has to stifle when he sees you would have woken you straight up. It’s a good thing he has just a shred of self-control, because it means you get to continue sleeping peacefully while Taehyung bites his lip as he watches you snuggle into him so sweetly. He wishes moments like this could last forever - the pressing feeling of happiness in his chest, the blush in his cheeks, the weight of your body half-sprawled on his and the happy sounds of a random show in the background all add up to one perfect evening,

“You’re such a little princess,” Taehyung teases, his words going unheard and you frown in your sleep, seeking out more of your boyfriend. He happily complies, gently laying you down across his lap. Your head rests under his hand as the other one gently plays with your hair, and the rise and fall of your chest as your breathing evens out feels comforting against Taehyung’s thighs. He goes back to watching the show quietly, throwing you a few glances every now and again solely because he can’t help himself. You look so beautiful and peaceful, and he just can’t get enough of you.

Masterlist

summary: What do you guys wanna see?
title: What do you guys wanna see?
body:
Basically,  Vos Anima Mea is winding down, so I’m contemplating what I should do next.

I have an idea for another chaptered story, involving Yoongi and a BDSM relationship  >.>

BUT I haven’t opened requests in awhile, either, and I love doing Fall/Halloween themed scenarios. 

So here’s the deal, I want you guys to let me know what I should do.

Start the Yoongi story right away? OR open up requests for a short while and then start the Yoongi story after?

Reply here or shoot me an ask!

blog.name: sunsetkm
blog.title: JM+JK
blog.description: “i'll go with jungkook even to the moon ”

summary: Why can’t some people just talk about how in this GCF, we finally had more screen time of the one and only GCF director himself?...
body:
Why can’t some people just talk about how in this GCF, we finally had more screen time of the one and only GCF director himself? Because I loved seeing more Jungkook footage in GCFs finally 💛


While we’re at it, GCF Newark showed how BTS are in a good place now; compared at the end of last year and the start of this year (not reaching, they mentioned it in Bangtan Dinner). More than anything, that makes me happy.


Thank you, Jeon Jungkook. I never thought I could love you more, but here we are!

summary:
Until The Spring Comes Again - Omelas!BTS AU 
Part 3
title:
Until The Spring Comes Again - Omelas!BTS AU 
Part 3
body:
Words: 1045

Warnings: Angst

Previous Part / Masterlist / Next Part

Hoseok stood at his door, a single bag in his hand. It was the next morning, he’s already had his breakfast, he’s already gotten dressed. By this time, he would normally be at work.

But today was different.

He stood at the door with a question. More of a choice than a question, actually.

The choice was simply in the direction he was going to go once he gets out of the door before him.

He could go right, down the street to Seokjin’s apologize and hope to mend their friendship.

He could go left, around the block and straight to the wall, through the gate and walk away from the city of Omelas like the hundreds before him.

He could go back inside, forget about the street, forget about the gate, forget about Seokjin and anything that isn’t inside his house.

He could forget, but he refused to. He opened the door and slammed it shut behind him. Omelas has changed since last night. Two more buildings have fallen and the people have gotten uneasy. When his eyes drifted across the street, he saw that numerous doorknobs on the houses have been bent or snapped away. he looked at his own doorknob. Nothing special, just a doorknob that he’s used so many times before. But now it meant the same question for him as the door.

Left or right?

He let go of the cold metal, set his bag on the ground and with a powerful kick, he made the metal bend slightly.

Are you sure? asked the doorknob.

He kicked again, stronger this time. The metal bent more, the doorknob repeating its question, more quietly this time.

Hoseok brought his leg up and kicked for the third time. The weakened metal jumped away and played a soft ringing melody against the pavement.

Very well, then. Goodbye. said a faint voice.

Hoseok bent down to look at the doorknob more closely.

He’s chosen his path with the first kick.

Left.

He picked up his bag and turned back to the street. No more questions.

Today was a strange day. The people of Omelas weren’t piling in lines to get to the festival grounds like every year. The Ferris wheel, the rollercoasters and all the stands were empty. The mayor, who would give a speech on the opening day of the festival was still buried under the tons of marble that came down with the city hall. Today was a strange day indeed, but the strangest thing had to be the happy people of Omelas accumulating at the city gates.

Most of the time, people walked away alone and in silence, if anything, leaving behind only a broken doorknob.

But today was a strange day.

Hoseok couldn’t help but think the same thing as he came around the corner to see a crowd of people leaving through the gate, all of them snuggling in their warmest coats with a bag in hand.

Hoseok stopped at the edge of the gate, the crowd giving him time for one last look at the city of happiness, the beautiful buildings and the cracking impression of paradise.

“Beautiful, isn’t it?” chimed a voice from below.

Hoseok looked to his feet finding the gate dweller there. He was watching the crowd move out of the city with a sheepish smile, wrapped in the little clothes he had on his body.

“Sure is, until it falls down on you,” Hoseok responded. The man stood up, now on the level with him.

“Is that why you’re walking away? You’re scared of a few bricks falling down?” said the man.

“No, not really,” he replied. “Why are you waiting here like that anyway?”

“I want to leave, but I don’t want to go alone,” replied the man and looked to his bare feet.

“Hoseok reached into his bag and pulled out a pair of winter boots he packed. “Here, the journey will be long,” he said.

“What journey?” asked the man, cautiously taking the boots and trying them on. They were a bit big but good enough for him.

“Our journey,” said Hoseok and pulled out a coat from the bag.

“You’re going to walk with me?” asked the man.

“Not only that. I’m gonna make sure you never walk alone again,” smiled Hoseok.

The man hugged him tightly, the gifted coat almost falling off his shoulders. “Thank you,” he whispered.

“No problem. Jung Hoseok, by the way,” he said when they parted and offered a handshake.

“Kim Taehyung, but please, call me Tae,” he accepted the handshake.

Hoseok grabbed his bag again.

The crowd was gone by now, all the people lost in the farmlands around the walls.

“Are you ready?” Asked Hoseok.

“I’ve waited for this moment for 4 months, of course, I’m ready,” laughed Tae.

They crossed the border of the city, leaving the beautiful gate behind them.

They weren’t sure where exactly they were going yet, but at that moment, both of them knew that he had found Omelas in the other.

________________________________________________________________

Seokjin couldn’t stop pacing back and forth through his apartment. Half of his mind was worried about himself, whether he is still safe in his house, whether he should move to avoid being the next one buried under marble. The second half, albeit quieter, was worried about Hoseok. Jin was afraid that Hoseok would do something stupid, that he took his words to the heart, that he had lost his friend to the cold forever.

He ran out of his home, only in his sweatpants and a sweatshirt. He would regret the decision as the winds have gotten colder near the evening again, but today he couldn’t care less. he ran down the same street Hoseok ran only in his pyjamas and a bathrobe.

His feet slipped slightly on the pavement, but he ran on. he got to Hoseok’s house and jumped over the fence. he ran up the four stairs in front of the door and grabbed the doorknob. To his horror, his hand found only air where the doorknob used to be.

He banged at the door, calling for his friend, but nobody opened.

He was alone.

Surrounded by the buildings of the city of happiness, he was but a child locked away in a dark room.

Previous Part / Masterlist / Next Part

Permanent Taglist:

@incorrectsvt

Series Taglist:

Nobody so far! PM me if you wanna tag along!

He could go left, around the block and straight to the wall, through the gate and walk away from the city of Omelas like the hundreds before him.

He could go back inside, forget about the street, forget about the gate, forget about Seokjin and anything that isn’t inside his house.

He could forget, but he refused to. He opened the door and slammed it shut behind him. Omelas has changed since last night. Two more buildings have fallen and the people have gotten uneasy. When his eyes drifted across the street, he saw that numerous doorknobs on the houses have been bent or snapped away. he looked at his own doorknob. Nothing special, just a doorknob that he’s used so many times before. But now it meant the same question for him as the door.

Left or right?

He let go of the cold metal, set his bag on the ground and with a powerful kick, he made the metal bend slightly.

Are you sure? asked the doorknob.

He kicked again, stronger this time. The metal bent more, the doorknob repeating its question, more quietly this time.

Hoseok brought his leg up and kicked for the third time. The weakened metal jumped away and played a soft ringing melody against the pavement.

Very well, then. Goodbye. said a faint voice.

Hoseok bent down to look at the doorknob more closely.

He’s chosen his path with the first kick.

Left.

He picked up his bag and turned back to the street. No more questions.

Today was a strange day. The people of Omelas weren’t piling in lines to get to the festival grounds like every year. The Ferris wheel, the rollercoasters and all the stands were empty. The mayor, who would give a speech on the opening day of the festival was still buried under the tons of marble that came down with the city hall. Today was a strange day indeed, but the strangest thing had to be the happy people of Omelas accumulating at the city gates.

Most of the time, people walked away alone and in silence, if anything, leaving behind only a broken doorknob.

But today was a strange day.

Hoseok couldn’t help but think the same thing as he came around the corner to see a crowd of people leaving through the gate, all of them snuggling in their warmest coats with a bag in hand.

Hoseok stopped at the edge of the gate, the crowd giving him time for one last look at the city of happiness, the beautiful buildings and the cracking impression of paradise.

“Beautiful, isn’t it?” chimed a voice from below.

Hoseok looked to his feet finding the gate dweller there. He was watching the crowd move out of the city with a sheepish smile, wrapped in the little clothes he had on his body.

“Sure is, until it falls down on you,” Hoseok responded. The man stood up, now on the level with him.

“Is that why you’re walking away? You’re scared of a few bricks falling down?” said the man.

“No, not really,” he replied. “Why are you waiting here like that anyway?”

“I want to leave, but I don’t want to go alone,” replied the man and looked to his bare feet.

“Hoseok reached into his bag and pulled out a pair of winter boots he packed. “Here, the journey will be long,” he said.

“What journey?” asked the man, cautiously taking the boots and trying them on. They were a bit big but good enough for him.

“Our journey,” said Hoseok and pulled out a coat from the bag.

“You’re going to walk with me?” asked the man.

“Not only that. I’m gonna make sure you never walk alone again,” smiled Hoseok.

The man hugged him tightly, the gifted coat almost falling off his shoulders. “Thank you,” he whispered.

“No problem. Jung Hoseok, by the way,” he said when they parted and offered a handshake.

“Kim Taehyung, but please, call me Tae,” he accepted the handshake.

Hoseok grabbed his bag again.

The crowd was gone by now, all the people lost in the farmlands around the walls.

“Are you ready?” Asked Hoseok.

“I’ve waited for this moment for 4 months, of course, I’m ready,” laughed Tae.

They crossed the border of the city, leaving the beautiful gate behind them.

They weren’t sure where exactly they were going yet, but at that moment, both of them knew that he had found Omelas in the other.

________________________________________________________________

Seokjin couldn’t stop pacing back and forth through his apartment. Half of his mind was worried about himself, whether he is still safe in his house, whether he should move to avoid being the next one buried under marble. The second half, albeit quieter, was worried about Hoseok. Jin was afraid that Hoseok would do something stupid, that he took his words to the heart, that he had lost his friend to the cold forever.

He ran out of his home, only in his sweatpants and a sweatshirt. He would regret the decision as the winds have gotten colder near the evening again, but today he couldn’t care less. he ran down the same street Hoseok ran only in his pyjamas and a bathrobe.

His feet slipped slightly on the pavement, but he ran on. he got to Hoseok’s house and jumped over the fence. he ran up the four stairs in front of the door and grabbed the doorknob. To his horror, his hand found only air where the doorknob used to be.

He banged at the door, calling for his friend, but nobody opened.

He was alone.

Surrounded by the buildings of the city of happiness, he was but a child locked away in a dark room.

Previous Part / Masterlist / Next Part

Permanent Taglist:

@incorrectsvt

Nobody so far! PM me if you wanna tag along!
trail.content:

Warnings: Angst

Previous Part / Masterlist / Next Part

Hoseok stood at his door, a single bag in his hand. It was the next morning, he’s already had his breakfast, he’s already gotten dressed. By this time, he would normally be at work.

But today was different.

He stood at the door with a question. More of a choice than a question, actually.

The choice was simply in the direction he was going to go once he gets out of the door before him.

He could go right, down the street to Seokjin’s apologize and hope to mend their friendship.

He could go left, around the block and straight to the wall, through the gate and walk away from the city of Omelas like the hundreds before him.

When his eyes drifted across the street, he saw that numerous doorknobs on the houses have been bent or snapped away. he looked at his own doorknob. “What journey?” asked the man, cautiously taking the boots and trying them on. They were a bit big but good enough for him.

The man hugged him tightly, the gifted coat almost falling off his shoulders. “Thank you,” he whispered.

“No problem. Jung Hoseok, by the way,” he said when they parted and offered a handshake.

“Kim Taehyung, but please, call me Tae,” he accepted the handshake.

“I’ve waited for this moment for 4 months, of course, I’m ready,” laughed Tae.

They crossed the border of the city, leaving the beautiful gate behind them.

________________________________________________________________

Seokjin couldn’t stop pacing back and forth through his apartment. Half of his mind was worried about himself, whether he is still safe in his house, whether he should move to avoid being the next one buried under marble. The second half, albeit quieter, was worried about Hoseok. Jin was afraid that Hoseok would do something stupid, that he took his words to the heart, that he had lost his friend to the cold forever.

He ran out of his home, only in his sweatpants and a sweatshirt. He would regret the decision as the winds have gotten colder near the evening again, but today he couldn’t care less. he ran down the same street Hoseok ran only in his pyjamas and a bathrobe.

His feet slipped slightly on the pavement, but he ran on. he got to Hoseok’s house and jumped over the fence. he ran up the four stairs in front of the door and grabbed the doorknob. To his horror, his hand found only air where the doorknob used to be.

He banged at the door, calling for his friend, but nobody opened.

He was alone.

Surrounded by the buildings of the city of happiness, he was but a child locked away in a dark room.

summary: BTS Reaction To You Being Dracula’s Child (Vampire Au!)
title: BTS Reaction To You Being Dracula’s Child (Vampire Au!)
body:
I’m back with some au’s because why the fuck not right :)


Jin

His eyes got wild and he gulped, letting slowly the information sink through his mind “I’m… Dracula’s… son in law?” He asked with a nervous voice, while you nodded “I think it’s better for me to start sharpen up my teeth”

YoonGi

For just a matter of seconds, you could see his skin getting more pale if it was even possible, his eyes stared at a random direction, looking lost “Do you think it’s possible for a vampire to die due excess of nervousness?”

HoSeok

You could see his fangs through his big smile, while he stood up “Really?! Oh my god, I’m such a big fan of him!” Hobi started to jump, clapping his hands in excitement “Wait! I have to start dressing up now to look worth it for his child!”

(look at my beautiful Sope guys, i love them so much ugh)

NamJoon

“You’re… wait” He paused himself for a second, letting his book by side and breathing calmly,  taking a little time to then look at you with a little smile “Now I see from were those pretty red eyes come from”

JiMin

“No way” His little hands now were on the sides of his face, almost tearing up his own velvet-like skin “H-How… How I’m gonna face him?! What you mean by relax?! Your father is just the most powerful vampire in the world and I can’t even turn to a bat without hitting my face with my own wing!”

TaeHyung

For just about a hour and a half, you thought somebody putted a spell on your boyfriend, because he literally didn’t flinched a muscle since the “news” “I just hope he doesn’t get mad about the fact that he is going to have plenty grandchildren”

JungKook

“He is real?” Jeon looked amazed by the fact that your father was actually a real life legend “My childhood hero… he is my s/o’s dad… I would say that this is a dream but vampire’s actually don’t dream”

(he is jungshook on the inside tho)
